Title: Apple AirPods Pro
Features: Active noise cancellation for immersive sound
Transparency mode for hearing and connecting with the world around you
Three sizes of soft, tapered silicone tips for a customizable fit
Sweat and water resistant
Adaptive EQ automatically tunes music to the shape of your ear
Easy setup for all your Apple devices
Quick access to Siri by saying “Hey Siri”
The Wireless Charging Case delivers more than 24 hours of battery life

reviews.caption: List of Features/Changes compared to Airpods (v2)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
reviews.review: Like iphone 11 Pro, Macbook Pro, Airpad Pro; the "Pro" denotes a higher end product.Compared to the Airpods (version 2) highest end model (with wireless charging case*); the Airpods Pro is $50 more MSRP.Compared to the non wireless case version it's $90 more*Airpods Pro does have wireless charging case by default. Only one version.Let's go through the differences1. Physical Appearance:Shorter Stem, but larger bud or headThere's a large black airflow grillA mic inside and outside the AirpodsCase is same thickness, a lot wider, but shorter. Still uses lighting cable to charge, but it does come with a lighting to USB-C cable2. In-ear, instead of on-earIf your ear has a small cavum and the original airpods fit perfectly, then the Airpads Pro may be a tight fit/more uncomfortable, but seeing the in-ear design, the ear piece will go into the ear canal and the rest will float in place.Those with normal or larger cavum it'll fit well.Some may not like the ear piece going into their ear canalThese ear phones are more for a closed environment than an open oneSeeing that it's an in-ear design, you may feel this hollow air effect going on unless you turn on transparency mode (more on this later) or play music with active noise cancelling onSeeing that it's in-ear, it has a tighter grip, better for joggers, those who shake their head around a lot for some reason, or if you run up stairs often. If you have an intense workout regimen and/or do extreme sports and not mindful it still can fall outThere's a Ear Tip Fit Test on app. There's several ear tips in box. When you turn on this feature in app it'll calibrate and suggest what ear tips are best listening experience for youIf you lose the tips or get them dirty overtime, you can go to the Apple store and get replacement pair for around $4 or get cheaper 3rd party ones when they come out3. Squeeze instead of tapInstead of tapping on the earbuds, you are pinching or squeezing the stem.1x to play, pause, and answer calls2x to skip forward tracks3x to skip back tracksPress and hold to switch between active noise cancel and transparency modeStill able to say "Hey Siri" to do voice commands/adjust volume anytimeNo physical volume controls on buds4. Battery lifeBattery life varies depending on how far away you are from the device and volume you set. Battery depreciation over time. These are just rough estimatesPro in general has 4.5 listening time with active noise cancelling or transparency on. Airpods version 2 has 5 hours. Note Airpod version 2 does not have active noise cancelling or transparency mode. You can get 5 hours with noise cancelling and transparency off, but most likely you're not going to unless you're really desperate for batteryPro has 3.5 talk time. Airpods have 3 hoursCase both old 24 hours battery lifePro: 5 mins in case = 1 hour talk or listen time. Airpods 15min in case = 3 hours listen, 2 hours talk5. Water/sweat resistantNow you can go to the gym and do cardio with them on.As mentioned before, tighter grip seeing that it's in-earMay survive light rain. Do not recommended going in the shower or dunk in the pool with it though 6. Active noise cancellation, Transparency modeAirpods pro has 3 modes: Active noise cancellation, off and Transparency modeActive nose cancellation tries to block out outside noise while listening to music. I'd say it drowns out may 70%. If you focus to outside or aren't focused to music; you still may be able to pick out what's going on, but in general it does it's job.Off is just like the standard in-ear headphones, but with the hollow air sound when no music is playingTransparency mode. The black airflow grills let in outside sound so you're able to hear both outside sound and music same time. Think of it as open ear headsets.Unlike some in-ear headsets the black airflow grills prevent you from hearing yourself in your head when you talk7. Sound QualityBetter than the previous version seeing the active noise cancelling and in-ear with more focused sound direcly into your ear canal. It's not $250 audiophile quality sound. Better quality sound in lows and mids compared to non-pro version. If you ever tried the Power Beats Pro, it sound very similar to thoseYou can hear callers better in a noisy environment and less likely raise your voice--Conclusion:Other than that, all other features are the same. Meant to be used on Apple devices. Very good ease of use for Apple users, and is in-style these days (shows social status). Sound quality is better that the non-PRO version, and you do get noise cancellation. There are other headphones that do it better sound in this price range, but may not be as convenient with pairing to Apple devices.

reviews.review: These earphones are top of the line.Here are some Highlighted FeaturesThey HaveIPX4 rated to resist sweat and water, making them ideal for sports and exercise.Internally tapered tips conform to your ear shape while vents help equalize pressure for maximum comfort.Active Noise Cancellation continuously adapts to the geometry of your ear and the fit of the eartips to keep you isolated from the world around you.Press and hold the force sensor on the stem to switch between Active Noise Cancellation and Transparency Mode, which allows outside sound in to keep you aware of your environment.Expanded mesh microphone port increases call clarity in windy locations.H1 headphone chip features 10 audio cores for low processing latency and real-time noise cancellation.Bluetooth 5.0 for reliable, high-quality reception.Automatically on, automatically connected.Voice-enabled access to Siri.Audio Sharing enables you and a friend to enjoy the same song or movie by simply bringing a second pair of AirPods close to your iPhone or iPad.More than 24-hour battery life with charging case

reviews.caption: Pro

reviews.review: So I will say I'm never wearing my bose 700's out in public (other than planes and other modes of transport that are too loud for the small in ear noise cancelation the Airpods pro have) there just too bulky and, but these new airpods are just so sleek and convenient, I'm an audio nerd if you want convenience these are probably the best buds to buy right now. Obviously sound could be better but for what you get I'd say it's worth every penny.Seif Afyouni.

reviews.caption: Hurt really bad. DO NOT BUY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
reviews.review: I’m gonna start off saying that the noise canceling is amazing ide rate 10/10. Where the problem is is after wear for 3 minutes it begins to hurt my ears dramatically. I tried every tip and none of them work. It seems to be the design of the earbud itself. I’ve personally loved all of apples products but I think they should have worked a little harder on this one. I’ve done research and I’m not the only one experiencing pain. There is thousands who say the same thing. The original AirPods are great and feel amazing in my ears where sometimes I forget I’m wearing them. If you have normal AirPods I would say your better off just using them.

reviews.caption: Dunno Why people are saying it's fake, but it isn't.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on November 23, 2020
reviews.review: It isn't fake Airpods Pro. In case if you are worried, just go to checkcoverage.apple.com and check your serial number of Airpods pro outside your box / inside Airpods pro. Amazon will refund your money in case they have sent you the fake airpods.In regards to Airpods pro, it is great value. There are tons of NC earbuds out there, but airpods pro is one of the best one in the market currently. I personally owned QC 30, Bose QC Earbuds, Sony WF-1000XM3, but airpods pro is the best among them. Bose QC Earbuds have better sound and better battery, but it is twice as big as airpods pro. Sony WF-1000XM3 has better NC, but it has terrible connection issue.So while Airpods pro may not have the best NC, Battery, or Sound quality, it is best all arounds. Solid NC, Solid SQ, Awesome connection and integration with other Apple devices, Spatial dynamic audio, small charging case, Good call quality and so on. It is a best-buy.The only issue that you might have is, some people - including myself - seem to have issue with the size of ear tips. Apple gives you S,M,L sizes of ear tips along with airpods pro, but unfortunately, none of them fits my ear perfectly. They either fall or feels very unease. This is why I took out a star from overall quality. Nonetheless, it is best out there and if you own Iphone, I don't see a reason for not buying this.

reviews.caption: Didn't think I would like them
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on December 16, 2020
reviews.review: First of all, I purchased this directly from Amazon. Look out for "Shipped & Sold by Amazon" - and you are guaranteed to receive a legitimate product. Other reviewers who are claiming that the product is counterfeit are probably purchasing from third party sellers.Let's get to the review.I am someone who does not enjoy the "in-ear" style earbuds. The ones with rubber tips that you jam into your ear canals. They are usually uncomfortable and give me headaches. For this reason, I have stuck with the traditional EarPods and AirPods design.Taking the jump to purchase AirPods Pro wasn't easy. It goes against all my beliefs and preferences for earphones. However, I must applaud Apple - because this is now my main listening device (previously an AirPods 2nd gen user). I learned that in-ear style buds cause me pain because of the build-up of pressure in the ear canal. The AirPods Pro have vents that regulate the pressure inside your ear, making it feel almost like the regular AirPods - invisible. If anything, I can wear these for hours until the battery dies, whereas the regular AirPods hurt after maybe an hour or so.Transparency mode and noise cancellation mode are easily switchable by holding the AirPods stem. I usually keep mine on Transparency mode, but it is nice to switch to noise cancellation mode for when my environment is too loud. FYI, the AirPods Pro come with different ear tips, so you will likely find one that will create the most optimal seal in your ear canal.As of writing this review, I purchased this on sale under $300 CAD. The fact that Apple makes their products work so well with each other is another reason that this is a good buy. If you have an iPhone/iPad, AppleTV, or MacBook, you can switch between devices so seamlessly - without re-pairing the AirPods each time. That is to say, my wife has used this with her Windows laptop and has no issues.Overall, I am glad I took the chance on these. Hoping to use this for many years to come.

reviews.caption: Muy buenos en general, pero con ciertos detalles.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Mexico on June 15, 2020
reviews.review: Primero tengo que destacar lo rápido que fue la entrega del producto, llegó muy Bien empaquetado, se veía nuevo, al sacarlos del empaque se veía todo muy bien, pero ahí empezó el primer “detalle” al conectarlos decía “Arpods Pro de Ricardo” lo cual no entendí, porque si son nuevos, no entiendo porque tiene que tener otro nombre.Total los eh probado 3 días han funcionado de maravilla excepto por un problema y MUY grave, se descarga mucho más rápido un airpods que otro.Por lo que si se mantiene ese problema desgraciadamente tendré que devolverlos, espero que se arregle o que exista un cambio por otra unidad.

reviews.review: Pedí estos auriculares pequeños porque tengo buena experiencia con la marca y estaba seguro que la relación calidad/precio sería buena. El paquete llegó en perfecto estado protegido en una caja aparentemente de aluminio con una imagen del producto en su parte posterior.Venía empaquetado en bolsitas blandas para protegerlo y el cable bien recogido con una sujeción para evitar que se liara.La mayor sorpresa es que venía una nota en el interior de la caja avisando de un regalo en el interior. Resulta que no solo me han mandado unos auriculares, si no que además han incluido una unidad extra del mismo modelo, por lo que por el precio de 1, LUDOS se ha molestado en regalarme otra unidad. Gracias porque los he probado y tienen un sonido fiel, aparte que se acoplan a mis oídos perfectamente.Cada unidad de auriculares viene con sus almohadillas extra para amoldar a cada persona.He probado el micrófono y es bastante decente para un manos libres, que es donde tenía pensado usarlo.Otro detalle que me encanta es que tienen regulador de sonido en su propia tarjeta de sonido, por lo que va independiente del sonido del dispositivo al que se conecta.Gracias LUDOS por este gran producto y por el regalo

Kostenlos ... als Trostpflaster für die nervige Corona-Zeit. Ich hatte schon von anderen hier von dieser Aktion gelesen, hätte aber nicht damit gerechnet, dass diese immer noch läuft.R-E-S-P-E-K-T und herzlich Dank dafür!Kommen wir zum Resümee:6x⭐ - 1x😡 = ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐NACHTRAG:Bei dem zweiten Paar Ohrhörer, das z.Zt. ja als Extra-Geschenk (!) einer Bestellung beigefügt wird, befanden sich lediglich 2 linke "Gummi-Teile", mit denen man aus den Ohrhörern "In-Ears" zu machen (keineAhnung, wie die Dinger heißen).Daraufhin schrieb ich den Kundendienst mit der Frage an, ob man mir vielleicht noch einen rechten schicken könne.Ich bekam umgehend Antwort und wurde ein paar Tage später dann nochmal kostenlos (!!!) mit zwei (!!!) kompletten (!!!) Ohrhörersets überrascht.Da bekommt man als Kunde ja schon ein ganz schlechtes Gewissen. 😔Herzlichen Dank und ein großes Lob für diesen tollen Kundenservice!!! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻Das gibt dann noch ein paar Sterne extra:⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

reviews.caption: OK, here's the deal:
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
reviews.review: I bought this headset for use at work as my #1 priority. And because we use MS Teams and Skype for Business at my workplace, that was a requirement. My workplace provided a wired headset for all of us when we moved to Skype for Business some time back. Most of us got Plantronics Blackwire wired models. They are perfectly fine; in fact they sound great for calls and the mics work very well. But when our group moved from relatively quiet semi-private walled cubicles to an open office environment where every conversation is audible even from 3 aisles away, I wanted something with some noise cancellation even if it meant paying for it myself. And because I was paying for it myself, I wanted something that I could use outside of work as well. I considered the on-ear Jabra Evolve 75 and over-ear Evolve 80 and I considered the Sennheiser MB 660 and Plantronics Voyager 6200 and 8200 UC. I settled on these because they are somewhat water-resistant so I can work out with them, they have great all-day battery life, and they are super portable.I have used them to work out several times and they are just OK for that. I think it probably depends on what kind of exercise you're doing. The ear buds don't fall out of my ears because the ear hooks keep them in place fairly well but the neckband can be annoying if you're jumping around or moving a lot. I don't imagine this is any different from any other neckband style headset so I'm not knocking them that. This was my first neckband-style headset so it's just something I noticed and point out here to anyone else who may be wondering. If you're on an elliptical or bike, it's fine. If you're doing high-impact aerobics or laying on a bench or floor it could become annoying. But I broke into a sweat with these several times and they were fine. I do sincerely wish I could find alternative ear gels for these. The ability to put some Comply foam tips on these would be great as it would help seal out even more noise. These are effective for canceling out steady noise like the HVAC at work but they aren't really great at blocking voices. Having tips that seal better would make these excellent instead of just OK.I have listened to music with these and they are not meant for audiophiles. If you are an audiophile you will find them a little heavy on the mid to low end. Some people like this though and it might be OK and I will say these are great for podcasts and audiobooks. These are really meant for spoken word listening. The clarity and detail retrieval for music is not anywhere near class-leading but I think most of us don't buy Bluetooth headphones with high expectations for this. We buy them because they are convenient. And these really succeed in that area for me because I don't ever have to take them off. I can pair these with my work laptop via the included dongle and also with my phone via Bluetooth and go back and forth between Skype calls/meetings, music, and podcasts without ever losing a literal beat. If I want to listen to my high-resolution audio and be a music snob I will put on "real" headphones and plug in via a headphone jack. I nevertheless keep these on and ready at all times during the work day and because they hang around my neck and mainly stay out of the way, it's easy to switch to another pair if I want.These sound great for calls (just as good as my wired Blackwire) and I've had no issues with using them on Skype for B and MS Teams calls and meetings at work. I like how the mute button works as it should within Skype. I read a lot of reviews and watched a lot of YouTube comparisons between these and they Voyager 6200 UC and these seemed to sound better because of the better proximity of the mic to your mouth. I also like that these are magnetic and are therefore less floppy. The Voyager doesn't have that feature. And because these are in-ear instead of over/on-ear, they're much easier to port around. I basically put them on before I leave the house in the morning and wear them home at night. No fuss. They take forever to charge but they really do last all day so I accept that trade-off.So these are worth $200 for me but if you don't need the Skype for B/MS Teams/Lync connectivity, I'd say don't buy these. There are so many better ways to spend $200 on Bluetooth earphones/headphones. In fact, you don't even need to spend that much. Get a Radsone ES100 and plug in your own high-quality headphones of choice. But if you want a portable Skype for B/Lync/Teams solution, I think this is a great choice.BTW - I saw a lot of reviews on Amazon saying they had problems with static and I first bought these from Amazon Warehouse to try to save a little money and that pair had that problem out of the box. I found it was an issue only when noise cancellation was on. I returned those and bought a new pair at full price. I have had them now for just about 2 months and haven't had any problems but I also bought an extended warranty since it did seem to be a fairly common problem. I will update if I run into that issue.

reviews.caption: the left earphone started to make very annoying and frequent static noises when I move even a ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2018
reviews.review: Spent two weeks with the 75e. Within a week, the left earphone started to make very annoying and frequent static noises when I move even a little bit. ANC is poor when compared to my old Bose QC20 and there is so much treble when playing music. I decided to return it to Amazon and bought a Bluetooth receiver for my old Bose QC20 so i can have a wireless ANC earphone

reviews.caption: Worked great until it didn’t.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2018
reviews.review: I used them almost daily for 10 hours. About 2 hours while riding on the train to and from the office paired with my iPhone watching YouTube clips or listening to podcasts. And about 8 hours of being on Skype calls, listening to music or just on standby paired with my laptop and my phone. Also used them a lot on few 3-4 hour plane rides.I enjoy the ability to pair this headset with two devices. ANC was great on the plane. Music and call quality sound good. Fit of the ear pieces work out fine but I’ve felt more comfortable tips.After about three weeks of using them, people I was on Skype and phone calls with were complaining about my mic audio. They all had different experiences. Some said they heard echos, some heard static, some said I was cutting in and out and some were experiencing a combination of the above.I really wanted this pair to work out. I bought them mainly for the three mic system and was hoping for good mic quality. I’m not a huge fan of over the ear headsets but love the boom mics that typically come with them. This pair seemed to be a good compromise. Unfortunately, after three weeks it’s become a problem. Now I’m stuck with an expensive headset.

reviews.caption: Not worth it, here’s why
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2018
reviews.review: For a headset at this price point you would expect the very best.ANC is decent, don’t expect total exclusion from your surroundings but it does a decent job at reducing the ambient noise around you.The microphone is okay, but the people on the other line will hear your background noiseWithin a month the left earphone started making this scratching and static noise with any movement, it’s entirely distracting and ruined this product for me.Honestly I wouldn’t purchase again if I had the choice. You are far better off saving the 200$ and buying another pair of headphones

reviews.caption: needs bigger tips
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
reviews.review: (update, 05 May 2019)Do not buy this product. My use case is very simple... 2x/wk, four hours each (beach). Tips get inserted one time at the start and stay there. Very limited flexing of anything. And five months in the left ear bud cable has failed. It's not like I beat on this thing, quite the contrary. Very limited use and still the thing failed mechanically at five months. FAIL. Sound is great, fit is great (although I continue to believe I would have benefited from larger tips), ANC works extremely well. And for $185 I get five months of use. *FAIL*(written early December 2018)Writing this two weeks in. I spend a lot of time at the beach and purchased these buds for the big battery (and specifically this unit as it has the least amount of neckband towards the front). My baseline is Plantronics BackBeat Go 2. I have three of them and I like them quite a lot... sound quality is good, no tan line :), surprisingly durable. You can't beat a BBG2 for $45. But I'm tired of having to return to my car for a fresh headset every 90min and so I bit the bullet here.The 75e has a break-in period, if these are new to you give it a good 10hrs of break-in. Once that happens, the sound opens up quite nicely. These are brighter then my old BBG2 units, but I feel like I could use larger ear tips (I use the big tips with my BBG2s and they are considerably larger than those that come with the 75e). If I'm lucky enough to get the 75e to seat *just right*, I get decent bottom end and very good range. Without that, though, the bottom drops out and all the presence leaves. And so I guess I'm happy-ish with these... but do wish I could get larger tips.

reviews.caption: Good and bad. Audio gets scrambled.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on July 28, 2019
reviews.review: My personal experience so far. The audio quality was very good majority of the time. I have the Jabra connected to my Android phone and also office laptop for Skype, GoToMeetings and VoIP business calls and demos. When the unit behaved well, I would get praise over how well I sounded when it worked well.Here is some real world feedback I experienced as I'm in week 2 of use. I'm in technical sales, also giving support, web demos, online training and on calls all day long. So I need a unit with long battery life, that can connect to both cell phone + laptop. The battery life kept up very well, plus I noticed if I plugged the unit in a USB power supply the 75e kept working. It would not close or disconnect - Fantastic.Connectivity was super easy to PC with the supplied Jabra Link 370 which VoIP, GoToMeeting, Skype etc detected.Without the 370 Bluetooth dongle, these apps would not configure, or detect the device. The Evolve 75e just wasn't listed as an available device, but playing audio on on media was detected on the PC. So for easy of use and detection, you may likely need the Jabra 370 dongle for your laptop or PC for some apps to work as expected. I also noticed that the Android apps "Jabra SOUND+", "Jabra Assist" and "Jabra Service" do not have the Evolve 75e on the list of supported devices nor connect to it. That was very disappointing as I could not configure the the 75e from my smartphone.Things began to slide to the negative as customers, prospects and employees began telling me my voice would occasionally come in distorted, clipped or uncoded correctly - that I sounded like a lost signal from Mars. That was very confusing to me as my phone and laptop would be 1-2 feet away from me or if mobile in my shirt pocket (so that wasn't far). I also noticed audio would come in garbled if I was 10 feet away or looked the other way from phone or dongle. Some would also say they could not understand what I was saying. On the listening side on calls coming in, the audio would cut out completely for a few seconds missing important information on a sales call or the person would come in wobbled ( distorted as if earpiece could not unscramble or decode audio quick enough). If I were in a room full of Bluetooth headsets, guaranteed the Jabra unit could clip out, loose decoding and get confused.I used the PC Version of "Jabra Direct" to update all drivers to the latest firmware to the dongle and 75e. This did not resolve the issue.Access to buttons around the neck is very difficult for me. I'm a wrestling kind of build, in my younger days worked out, served our country in the military and have a solid bulky frame. I gather being much older now and behind the desk I'm way heftier. I thought what the heck !!! As I put this on my neck, this didn't look like the pictures, the buttons are on the side of my neck and I can't see the red light (in a call indicator) if on or off. So I had my teenage son who is 120 lbs try it on, he is thin as rails and no issue. Case in point, if you have a thick neck or of large build like me, the photo attached will show you what to expect.One think that was nice, they ear buds do not slip out. Also the neck band in the back is a bit stiff and the unit would not slide to the left or right and slip off.A fight over PC calls, Cell calls or 2nd cell call coming in. I haven't yet figured out how to control the Jabra 75e from reacting when I'm in session using audio/mic while on Skype or a VoIP call, then a cell call comes in and a 2nd cell call comes in. I've been on customer calls, when a 2nd cell call comes in and my conversation gets cut off. Yup... I just get cut off... and then I'm freaking out wondering where did my client go. I have to hit the ignore call on my phone to get the person back. Then the Jabra 75e goes crazy when I end the call, VoIP or Skype or GoToMeeting and the Jabra won't respond at all. I noticed the "In Use" light would stay on the Jabra 75e, I would have to shut down and reboot the PC, disconnect the Bluetooth from my phone, and shut down the power button on the Jabra 75e. Then restart all the devices to get back to normal. This happened a few times. As if the Jabra lost a signal to say disconnect, the call ended buddy, your not in session anymore. What madness.

reviews.caption: Jabra Evolve 75e MS
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on September 12, 2020
reviews.review: Use them everyday with laptop (via included USB-A dangle) and a phone via Bluetooth at the same time. Works on Linux, Mac and Windows as well. The only thing is the active noice cancelling is quite weak and I would not even bother saying it has it. The rest is nice and I use it every day for all meetings from hime and on a go. The mic seems to be quite good and blocking low frequency noice but struggling blocking high pitch voices if you are in the coffee shop. Still quite good and voice quality is so much better than Apple AirPods Pro for sure.

reviews.caption: Design Flaw and Mic noise cancelation is terrible.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on February 8, 2021
reviews.review: 1. After couple of months light usage, the right unit began to develop static noise every time you touch the joint of cable and neck band. - I don't think I am the only person who has this problem by searching the comments, it is a design flaw.2. Mic noise cancellation is terrible, they can hear load and clear of my ambient sound...

reviews.caption: Poor Noise Cancellation, Otherwise Fine
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on May 26, 2020
reviews.review: First, the good: Audio quality is solid (for voice or music), they're comfortable to wear for an eight our workday, and the battery will outlast comfort (so you'll take them off before the battery runs out).The noise cancellation is pretty bad though. It's not so much cancellation as a constant hissing in your ear to drown out ambient noise. Noise cancellation also degrades audio quality and battery life. Since I bought these for noise cancellation, I am very disappointed.If you turn off the noise cancellation, then they're a set of good quality (if overpriced) headphones.

reviews.caption: No noise cancellation
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on June 24, 2019
reviews.review: Noise cancelation is very weak or does not existEar plug is not comparable, but that could be my earNeeds request re-sync,Mic picks up noise and wind, opposite to what they advertise

reviews.caption: Nice Color, Dead Earbud
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
reviews.review: I am disappointed. This company was described to me as top of the line with a product that would fit a woman's smaller ear. While the second part has been met, unfortunately the first leaves me questioning what is considered too of the line these days. The earbuds are comfortable but do not always stay in place. Also, the right one keeps going dead; I have to turn off the headset and turn it back on a few times before I can get both working. This is annoying and interrupts my work flow. I like the color of this headset, but I do not know if I would buy another JBL.

reviews.caption: Great bang for the buck!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
reviews.review: Great product. These headphones have lasted longer than any I've had. I work in a machine shop with lots of ambient noise and I listen to nothing but books and podcasts. With other sets I've struggled to hear a narrators voice whilst working for some reason and for some reason I always lose function in the left bud. Not so with these. After 4+months of near constant use (8+ hrs a day) I can still hear perfectly clearly in both sides. Although these buds have less functions than some I happily make that trade for a product that lasts longer. Well done.👏

reviews.caption: Terrible Headphones
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
reviews.review: I already did the review as to why I hate them but the site freaking FROZE up so here I am again.They are TERRIBLE sounding head phones.They are so HIGH PITCHED my hearing took 30 min to remotely turn back to normal that and dealing with paperwork for 25-28 languages. Battery might be fine but I can’t rate it.I would definitely give them a Minus rating.Thanks anyways.

reviews.caption: Sounds ok , connects fine just way too light slides off neck to easy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
reviews.review: This is so light its like trying to keep a piece of yarn on your neck.Its always slipping off or going sideways off my neck so has to be returned.I need to find one with a more heavy duty band.

reviews.caption: Uncomfortable, poor range and mic. No thanks!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
reviews.review: These feel gross in your ears especially if you’ve experienced headphones with natural and/or simulated pass through like the AirPods and AirPods Pro. I honestly can’t recommend these when better technology exists at $100 (AirPods on sale). Also, these use Bluetooth 4. Don’t expect to walk more than six feet away from your phone or computer before the signal drops. As for the sound quality, I love JBL’s portable speakers. However, these are trash. Don’t bother.

reviews.caption: Awesome During Morning Outdoor Workouts and Gardening
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
reviews.review: I like these and would buy again. The sound quality is great, and when music or other media are playing, you hear no outside or interfering noises. I chose these because I was more comfortable with the wired Bluetooth device than wireless earbuds. They stay in place as I jog or walk. JBL has always lived up to their name, and my opinion.

reviews.caption: Good deal!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
reviews.review: So far so good. Awesome sound! Light weight. Easy to operate. Really sounds good when you adjust the source... able to adjust my phone to get great sound

reviews.caption: Very Pleased
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
reviews.review: These earbuds are fantastic. They are easy to pair, charge quickly, and deliver great sound. I'm happier with these than I am my expensive separated earbuds.

reviews.caption: Great sound
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 28, 2021
reviews.review: This is my second pair Love the sound I get from them . I listen to alot of Reggae Music so they do the job with the extra Bass.

reviews.caption: Would recommend these as excellent value

reviews.review: I had the 110 and you can tell these are better, more bass

reviews.caption: Excelente sonido y materiales de fabricación.

reviews.review: Excelente sonido, los bajos son muy profundos, el sonido es muy fuerte, muy cómodos y los materiales con los que está fabricado es de calidad.El cables lo suficiente largo para manipular.Se los recomiendo ampliamente.Si los encuentras en oferta no dudes en comprarlosPara ejercicio no los recomiendo ya que por el peso de mueven mucho y se caen con facilidad.

reviews.caption: Sin perfectos para actividades de oficina y casa, no para ejercicio.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Mexico on October 13, 2020
reviews.review: Sinceramente el modelo esta muy completo. Se oye bastante bien. Yo lo uso con volumen al 50% o max al 60% porque se me hace muy fuerte. Se oyeb bien los bajos y los agudos. De hecho pude escuchar sonidos que nunca había escuchado de canciones que conozco desde hace mucho. Los regreso solo porque realmente no funcionan para hacer ejercicio. Pensé que como hago yoga me acomodarían, pero se mueven. Para uso común de oficina o casa están perfectos. Además el imán es muy cómodo.

reviews.caption: Great everyday bluetooth headphones
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on January 14, 2021
reviews.review: Have used these for a few days and they are a great everyday wired (L+R earbud connected with a wire w/ battery pack) bluetooth in-ear headphone! Comes with 3 sizes of ear pieces- they are a soft, comfortable material. Tangle free flat cord isn't too heavy and does not pull the earbuds out. Charging cord (USB A to USB Micro I think) is a bit short so if your charging location is far away or hidden behind something you might be in a bind.Clear, smooth sound with good bass. You shouldn't need to crank these up!Pairs seamlessly with my Iphone7.Good quality for the price.

reviews.caption: Tiny, good sound, but hear-through mode is a letdown
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
reviews.review: These are the smallest earbuds + case I've ever had, and the sound is surprisingly good. My main issue ( for the price ) is that the hear through mode works, but it sounds very unnatural, seeming to focus on the upper mids and going in and out as played music changes. I wouldn't trust it to have it on when walking my dog to hear traffic, so I'd take out one of the headphones, which eliminates the point of hear through for me. Otherwise very solid and really can just attach these to your keychain and have audio with you whenever and wherever!

reviews.caption: 10/10 recommend! Love the color options and overall quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
reviews.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Love the yellow color and the many different color options that are offered — it ensures there is something for everyone. The sound quality is amazing, the headphones are extremely light, comfortable, and secure to wear; they stayed put during a HIIT workout. Also I love that each earbud has a “quick touch” control feature; you can pause, skip songs, adjust the volume, etc., by touching the outer surface of each ear bud. In addition, they charged extremely fast as well. Lastly, if the basic earbuds it comes with aren’t the right size, it comes with larger and smaller ones to adjust for your perfect fit.Great value and quality for the price point!

reviews.caption: Tiny But Mighty...for the price!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2021
reviews.review: I was looking for a good replacement for my airpod pro's that will no longer hold a charge, while I like my airpods I'm not in love with the price & these are a great alternative for me. I have listened to music, watched movies, listened to audiobooks, and podcast; additionally I have paired these with both android and iOS devices as well as my samsung smart tv and here is what I have found.These buds are compact and great if you just want to grab and go. I usually have issues with finding earbuds that fit and are comfortable but I find these to fit well and feel secure and I appreciate these do not have a stem like my airpods so they are more discrete and stay in place very well.Sound Quality: is definitely better than expected for the price. These seem to focus more on vocal clarity rather than bass. If you are planning to listening to audiobooks, podcast, and movies these buds really outdo themselves. Music listening is still good but don't expect the bass you will get in the more expensive alternatives.Battery Life: Battery life on these are impressive, I got about 5 hours on a single charge and the charging case will extended that to 24hrs of active listening. Charging the case and buds is also quick and easy.Pairing and Touch Controls: These are easy to pair, just take them out and tap both buds then pair on your device; pairing is automatic thereafter. These have easy to use tap controls similar to those on airpods and galaxy buds. These also work with Siri and Google Assistant.

reviews.caption: Cute earphones with good sound quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021
reviews.review: This is my very first wireless earphones because I have wireless noise-cancelling headphones, but I wanted something small to bring to my work in the lab. I got this in the color of peach and it’s a cute color which matches the online photos.Unboxing experience was nice. It opens like a book (magnetic cover) but there is three secure tape of the clear cover over the product. It was very easy to get the items out.The manual says to let the earphones charge for 10 minutes. While charging I notice it was around 75% charged because of the number of blinks displayed behind the charger case. Without charging for 10 minutes, I was able to pair the earphones to my iPhone easily. But only one ear was playing music. So I let the earphones charge overnight via outlet.After charging overnight, I paired it to my laptop and, again, it was very easy to find and pair. The music quality is great. You can hear the bass. I don’t have any complaints. These aren’t comparable to noise-cancelling headphones but these will do for the convenience of having something small and wireless.They also stay in my ears quite well, even with head movements and jumping. Battery life so far is lasting as expected (5+ hours).

reviews.caption: Great alternative to my AirPods
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021
reviews.review: Background: I'm an Apple AirPod user for about 2-3 years now, so I'll be comparing those to my experience with these earbuds. I listen to a lot of rap/hiphop/top 40.Sound: AirPods had better clarity and bass at lower volumes, at higher volumes the sound was more comparable, noise cancelling was impressive, better than my AirPodsFit: Fits better in my ear that AirPods, was able to do a HIIT workout without having them fall outDesign: smaller than the AirPods, which I prefer. also comes with a D ring which is low key a necessity so you can strap it to backpacks/bags etc.Color: I got the yellow color and it really popped, looks eye catching in personCharging/Setup: charges faster than my AirPods, setup with my iPhone was a breeze with the included instructionsBattery Life: gets a good 6-7 more hours than my AirPods, no longer have to worry about not having charged earbudsOverall, this is a great purchase. Would I get it again? Yes. Would I get it over AirPods? At this price, yes, barring the sound quality at lower volumes, I think these perform better than AirPods in other categories such as fit, style, and battery life.

reviews.caption: No bass! Very disappointed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
reviews.review: I've read many reviews and they've mentioned they hear deep bass. NOT! I barely hear the bass, its mostly highs and mids. I'm so disappointed! Soul needs to add more bass. I've adjusted the sound equalizer on my Galaxy s21 and no change. It sounds like lower end ear phones attached with a cord you plug into your phone jack you get from Walmart. I paid $75 includes tax & s/h. Not worth it! I think they're worth $30. I used to have an Apple i6 and the ear phones had bass.

reviews.caption: Counterfet alert: These are not what they used to be.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2019
reviews.review: A couple years ago, I ordered five well-rated headphones at once to compare quality over price. These were the overall winner, and I've purchased several more over time.Unfortunately, the latest batch is a completely different product. Either Panasonic started skimping on production or these are cheap counterfeits (more likely). I just plugged these into my electronic drum kit and literally could not hear the kick drum's bass sound at all. I thought my kit was messed up, but instead plugged in an older pair of these and noticed not only a clear rolling bass, but all of the sounds were much fuller and richer.It's a shame that Amazon isn't doing anything about counterfeiting. The positive reviews here are outdated and worthless.

reviews.caption: Beware as these are not able to be returned through Amazon if defective.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
reviews.review: When I first opened these they fit very comfortable in my ears. When I tried listening to them the sound in the right ear kept shorting out. Went to Amazon to try to return them and learned I could not return them even though I had just purchased them a few days ago. Instead I was given the phone number to Panasonic customer support. I was disconnected twice from customer support while they tried to transfer me to the right person. I realize these headphones we’re only $8 but it’s the principle of it that they make you jump through all of these hoops from the manufacturer to return a defective product. Normally Amazon returns items quickly with little effort. Given all of the positive reviews of these headphones I am assuming I just got a defective pair.UPDATE: I called Panasonic to start a return. They told me I would have to ship the $8 earbuds to them first then they would fix them and send them back to me. Very disappointed as it would cost me at least that much to ship them in the first place. Not a fan of Panasonic right now and surely will never buy any Panasonic headphones again.

reviews.caption: If you get a defective pair, don't expect any customer service help and say goodbye to your money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2018
reviews.review: I purchased a pair of these earphones in December 2017 due to the overwhelming number of positive reviews. When they first arrived I was so happy with the sound quality, comfort level in-ear, and their ability to block outside noise. I use my headphones for schoolwork or to watch movies on my computer; I am by no means rough with them, I store them carefully, I'd had my last pair for 8 years, etc. However, only one month after purchase, the left earphone suddenly shorted out and ceased working. I attempted to return them through Amazon and was instead told to contact Panasonic directly.I tried numerous times to use the Panasonic website's live chat support feature but kept getting a message that there were no employees on live chat at this time (no matter what time of day I tried). I then called their 1-888 support number and the first thing the automated message warned me was that I risked being charged a $9.99 service fee for help if I continued with the phone call and if my product turned out not to be covered under warranty. Given that I didn't know if the earphones were still covered under any limited warranty, I opted to just hang up at that point, write off my money spent, and order a second pair. They arrived on January 25, 2018, and again, I was satisfied. Less than two weeks later, while watching a homework video, the right earphone suddenly shorted out and stopped working.I called Panasonic again figuring that this time it had to be covered under some warranty at less than 2 weeks old. The customer service rep sent me the e-mail instructions to submit my proof of purchase for both pairs and I later received an e-mail back with the instructions for shipping the headphones. They stated that I was only allowed to ship the product in one specific type of corrugated cardboard container, that it needed to be certain size of that container, and that I would need to pay for tracking and insurance on the product on top of the shipping. The total amount for shipping cost more than THREE pairs of these headphones and they wouldn't guarantee that they would send me two new pairs to replace the two broken ones.This is the worst experience I've ever had with a purchase from Amazon. I was disappointed and frustrated that I could not conduct my return directly through Amazon and have a replacement sent to me or my money refunded like is usually the case on Amazon, but instead had to do the whole runaround with Panasonic, and I still don't know whether Panasonic will honor its warranty and send me two new pairs. Based on the number of positive reviews for these earphones it seems like I did just get unlucky (twice) with defective pairs, however, if you're one of those unlucky ones you can count your money spent as lost based on the incredible hassle and lack of good customer service to make it right.

reviews.caption: The only headphones you truly need...
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on March 21, 2016
reviews.review: So here's the thing: in recent years I've spent way, way more than I care to admit on headphones. I have been trying desperately to find the perfect sound.Still haven't found it, but, I've come to realize one very simple fact: convenience, comfort, and fit are more important than absolute audio quality. These buds nail that mix. They produce about 85% the sound quality as the best audio I've heard, and fit exactly right for my ears like truly nothing else on the market.My previous go-tos were a pair of pricey earbuds with memory foam tips, and also "audiophile" Yuin PK1s that look like circa 1990 Gameboy earbuds.And yet... the memory foam buds were also too bulky for the foam to make a difference to fit... the PK1s are phenomenal when they are seated JUST SO in your ear, but don't you dare move your head, and anything approaching workout use is laughable. High end open backed over-ear 600ohm requires-an-amp cans may sound great, but are completely impractical for day to day use and travel scenarios (unless you're "that guy/gal" - and please don't be).So here's what I propose: forget the high end stuff and buy several pairs of these Panasonics. Throw one into your laptop/book bag, your purse/murse, your desk drawer... use and abuse them day in, day out. When they break, buy them again. They're cheap, and they work great.--------Other stuff:- Good bass, curtailed highs... far from reference, but well suited to the modern pop musics the kids listen to these days- Don't need a mic? You can save a few bucks and buy the HJE-120s instead- Short-ish chord is great for mobile use, but when seated at a desk don't forget they're in your ears if you try to stand up (ouch)- There's an audiophile term for when you can hear the wire moving and jostling about through the earbud. Can't remember what it is, but it applies to these- Very, very, very good fit. Leads to good bass, good sound isolation, and you simply forget they're there and focus on the music instead- Inline mic works! Surprisingly good quality in quiet environments, but clearly omnidirectional and prone to picking up ambient noise

reviews.caption: Probably fakes
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on November 24, 2016
reviews.review: I've bought this model of Panasonic headphones numerous times before. I believe these are fakes. They came in small pouches instead of the usual hard plastc shell packaging. Also, the description said that 3 pairs of different sizes soft earpads were included, but I didn't get them. I can't use them because the pads are too big for my ears. Buyer beware!

reviews.caption: Very comfortable and great sound quality for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 20, 2020
reviews.review: I wanted a comfortable headset for zoom/skype calls as well as well as listening to music. I spent ages looking around and settled on these, almost in spite of their price. They didn't disappoint. People comment on the good mike sound when I'm on a call, and when Iisten to recordings of zoom calls I've been on, the sound quality is more pleasing that of some people wearing obviously expensive headsets with a mike near the mouth. It's a mellow but clear sound, not precise but harsh like many. The sound on the earbuds is also very pleasant.It doesn't seem prone to clothes rustling sounds transmitting to the mike, like many of this sort, or cable rustling sounds coming thru to the earbuds, although of course some of that happens.The connector feels sturdy, and hopefully less prone to disintegration that the straight connectors.And the hype is true, the earbuds themselves fit very neatly and comfortably.I've only had them a few weeks, so longevity is unknown.I dont usually review items, but felt that this deserves a shout-out, and I'd happily pay double the price.

reviews.caption: Way below Panasonic level
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 23, 2021
reviews.review: This are cheap rubbish rather than being a Panasonic level product. The sound quality is poor, the connection to my phone is poor (so I kept loosing sound when trying to make a call with the phone in my top pocket). They are even difficult to fit comfortably in my ears (I have relatively narrow openings in my ears to fit these in). Very disappointing.The only good thing I can say about them is I actually liked the blue/teal colour they came in (making them easier to spot than all black items).

reviews.caption: Not worth it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 1, 2020
reviews.review: Cheap packackaging, hard to cut open. I could have easily forgiven that if the quality of the product had been better. They looked and felt cheap (flimsy cords) and the sound qulity was way more inferior than other products I have tried in the past. Tinny, no base. I honestly don't know how some users gave these good ratings. I ordered four pairs based on good reviews, ended up giving one pair away to my son who said "they're better than nothing," and sent the other three back. Giving one star bc of sound quality. After all, that's why I bought them.

reviews.caption: $30 Well spent 👍
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2018
reviews.review: I like these ear buds a lot! I ordered them on a Friday, got em by Saturday which is the first time that's every happened with any I bought from Amazon. They come with a year warranty from the manufacturer (a nice touch), a charger case, micro USB cord and 3 types of replacement tips. I love these because their very compact. I keep them in my pocket all the time and almost forget their there. I mostly use them at work or around the house. The range is really good too. I left my phone in my living room and could still hear my music in the basement bathroom and upstairs bedroom, which is the best bluetooth headphones experience I've personally had.The battery life is great too. Fully charged them on Monday and they finally died on Thursday. Again I only use them for 1-2 hours at a time but that's still good. It only takes a full hour to charge the case too. They pair easily as well. Once you set it up once that's it. Take em out the case, put em in and that's it.My sole drawback is the sound quality. They aren't bass heavy like some people will tell you but they get the job done. Works great for videos and any kind of music with the exception of hip-hop which is 75% of what I listen too. Their only loud in small isolated areas which isn't a bad thing but they could still sound just a little better. Also there's no volume or track control on the master ear. You can only pause or accept calls but that's still not a big deal. All in all, I definitely recommend and would honestly buy again if needed. Their only $30 anyway. Buy em!

reviews.caption: I’M SUPER SURPRISED!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
reviews.review: First off these have so much bass!!! These sound like Beats or even Sony headphones! They are better than AirPods in my Opinion because they have more bass than AirPods. The case is really small and really portable. You can put these in your pocket easily. I love how portable these are! The battery life is very good. They are very noise insulating, which is good for keeping out noise. They come with extra ear tips if you lose some. They fit pretty well and don’t fall out.

reviews.caption: Awesome and easy to use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
reviews.review: I have never had Bluetooth ear pieces before, but I have friends that have bought some for up to $100! These have displayed the same quiality, of sound and material and although I have not had them long enough to test their durability, you can buy the warranty which I find very nice to have, especially for a product that I use so frequently. These are awesome for working out, as well as any other activity that would require head phones. They are also really easy to figure out, there are not any complicated sets of command buttons, all actions can pretty much be done by pressing on the right ear bud once, or for 3 seconds for a few others. Definitely recommend. P.S this would also make a great gift as the packaging comes in a neat little black box, so it's quite simple to gift wrap.

reviews.caption: High Quality Budget Earbuds
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2018
reviews.review: I use these earbuds on my walk to school and work daily, and so far they will stay charged through the whole day with the assistance of the charging case. Even with the volume at 70%, they drown out the sounds of cars passing by. The sound quality is certainly comparable to that of Air Pods, though these don't have many of the features that Air Pods do. These ear buds don't have volume control on them, which is my biggest gripe currently. However, they come with a free one year warranty and their customer support has been great, so the value in these is not only in the device features. Overall I would highly recommend these to anyone thinking about buying wireless earbuds. Even if these don't meet all your needs, they will give you a chance to find out what features are important to you at an affordable price point!

reviews.caption: Pleasantly surprised...but then.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2018
reviews.review: Update: I’ve had these for about a month and a half now...the button cover on the left ear bud fell off and is not able to be reattached. Additionally, there is more difficulty connecting Bluetooth and I initially realized. You have to completely turn of the bud and reconnect every time if you are switching between devices. My advice to get Enacfire is much stronger now.Original review: I got these after my Enacfire E18 headphones were stolen. They were much better quality but I couldn't afford to buy another pair (which are $20 more than these). Some things I miss with this pair:1. These are bigger than expected. My ears run on the small side so they start to get uncomfortable after a while and are a little more visible (if that is a factor).2. The buds have a much more plastic-like quality and feel cheaper (which they are) than Enacfire's.3. They have two small blue lights on the bottom of each bud that flash every few seconds when connected (very annoying, especially when watching a movie in the dark).4. The buds do not magnetically connect to the charging box as with Enacfire E18. This means they could fall out more easily (but if you have the top closed it not a problem...and the top has to be closed for the buds to charge).5. When you double-click the bud it redials the last number you called instead of changes the song (as with my other pair). I find the latter more useful.Most of these (the last two especially) are nit-picky things and if I had not had Enacfire before I wouldn't see any problem with these. They stay in my ears, they aren't too hard to hide (if you have longish hair), the sound quality is great (I can hear the small of detail in songs and feel the base notes). Conclusion: if you have an extra $20 to spend I suggest Enacfire; if you don't then get these.

reviews.caption: A high quality ear piece set for listening to music
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2018
reviews.review: The quality of the Tozo T8 is very high, as demonstrated by the sound transmitted to the units. I use it mainly to listen to music on YouTube on my TV at night, and the equipment does not let me down. The T8 is good for 2 hours, more than enough time for listening prior to going to sleep. In addition, the company is very honorable, and stands behind its warrantee...I had a small problem with one of the earplugs, and there was no problem in getting it corrected....

reviews.caption: Good Quality, Comfortable and Light
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviews.review: These fit great and have great sound quality for the price. They are lower profile than regular AirPods and don’t look like an imitation pair, which is nice. I have worn them for 3 hours at times and they haven’t become uncomfortable like my other headphones in the past.

reviews.caption: Great Product!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
reviews.review: I love this product! The sound quality is great and the comfort is amazing. I can sit and watch things on my computer for long periods of time without any discomfort. They come with a bunch of different sizes of plastic ear pieces so they can stay in your ears without any discomfort. The only issue that I have with this product is whenever I try to pair the product to one of my devices, only one of the earbuds work. When it doesn't work, I put the earbuds back into their case, and take them out and they work fine. I haven't charged the earbuds case for 2 weeks and they are still going! I have dropped the earbuds themselves without the case twice and they are still working. Great product and great price! I love the color of the mint green. I would definitely recommend!

reviews.caption: Sound is excellent...mic not so much
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
reviews.review: The sound quality is great but when I tried to take a call the person on the line said I sounded very quiet and seemed like the sound was far away. When I switched to my phone speaker, she said I sounded much better. Set up and pairing was easy and instructions easy to understand.

reviews.caption: Great product for the cost.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021
reviews.review: The sound quality is really good. The comfort is very nice and the battery life is strangely long. The only complaint I would say I have with this product is once you place the earbuds back into the case they begin to charge and the LED light on the outside of the case is extremely bright and stays on constantly during charge. Easily fixed by turning the case over.

reviews.caption: Finally!!! Earbuds that stay in place! Good value, price and sound!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
reviews.review: Finally !!!!!! Headphones ( earbuds ) that stay in my ears!!! Bought these for listening to my French and Spanish language lessons, overall music listening, and audiobooks and podcasts. Just opened up the box and used my earbuds and right away I was impressed by the easy instructions that they came with. You don’t have to be high-tech savvy to use these. They come with a compact charging unit that easily indicates when buds are fully charged. Sound is 5 stars for me! I’m no musician or sound expert, but voices are clear and music is sharp and detailed enough for my ears and I love the convenience of these buds and how they easily sync to my phone. Pleasantly pleased with the price too! Thumbs up purchase!

reviews.caption: Best value earbuds....EVER!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
reviews.review: I absolutely love these little guys. Very good noise reduction....so good that I usually only wear one at a time since most of the time I need to be at least semi-aware of my surroundings. Pairing is easy, though the distance-from-phone could be a little stronger. Does not matter too much for me since I'm usually wearing something that I can easily stow my phone on my person, but if you're hoping to leave your phone sitting somewhere and stray far, don't. Battery life is incredible. I don't take a lot of calls on these but I do have my music and Audible books playing a good portion of the day. Excellent product, highly recommend.

reviews.caption: Absolutely worth the purchase
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
reviews.review: I didn't expect these earbuds to be as great as they are, but I am pleasantly surprised. They fit in my ears perfectly, and the sound is exactly what I need it to be. I am usually watching my tv shows on my phone laying on my side and I needed a pair of earbuds that would be comfortable enough to have both in and lay on my side and these are just the ones did that. And the battery life in the buds alone last a long time, not to mention how long the charging case holds a charge for. They connected quickly to my phone the first time and I've had no issues with connection at all. Definitely recommend these!

reviews.caption: Efficient!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
reviews.review: I love it overall, very useful, easy to work with and love that u can change the song with a long tap or double tap for stop. My only problem right now is that it starts to get a little glitchy, only a little, idk why, maybe it's because someone close to me had there bluetooth on.🤷 But hey otherwise these earbuds are a good cheap price and REALLY REALLY efficient, I love the features! P.s - remember to take out the right earbuds first when wanting to use it

reviews.caption: Holy Moly!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
reviews.review: I have lots of earbuds and headphones. Some of them are very pricey. So why did I need to buy these?I am a biker. I wear a full face helmet with a Sena system that wirelessly connects to my Samsung S8. I have speakers installed in the helmet. They sound 'ok' but produce a tinny sound. No bass at all. I've been using this system for three years now. The Sena comes with a jack to plug in and use earbuds if I choose. However, they don't stay in the ear well when pulling the helmet on and off. They also never produced a sound much better than the speakers installed in the helmet. I pretty much gave up on finding a solution to better sound in my helmet.Enter the KZ ZSN Dual Driver Headphones! They fit in the ear much like a hearing aid. I surmised that this type of earbud might work well with a helmet. But if they didn't produce sound quality any better than the helmet speakers what would be the point in using them? I figured it was worth a shot considering the price.Holy Moly! These headphones are incredible! I have some very expensive Sony headphones I use in my videography business. The KZ ZSN headphones are on par with them! I never imagined having that kind of sound in my helmet. My S8 has a built in equalizer that allows me to adjust the audio frequencies. All of the earbuds and speakers I previously used/tested pretty much had no change from the equalizer adjustments. The sound from the KZ ZSN headphones is phenomenal. They also stay in my ears perfectly when pulling the helmet on and off.KZ ZSN sells pro headphones that are a little over twice the price of these featuring five drivers! Not only am I going to buy three more pair of these (presents), I am going to buy the five driver model as well! I couldn't be more pleased with this product.I highly recommend this product!

reviews.caption: VERY VERY GOOD BUT...read on.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019
reviews.review: I purchased these KZ ZSN PRO “budget/value IEMs after becoming curious of their sound benefits due to the amount of live musicians using them. Well after weeks of trying different ear tips and becoming frustrated due to their mid and high end bias. I tried my FOAM tips. Wow, what a difference! They made these KZ IEMs completely neutral and more importantly a permanent part of a ridiculously large headphone+earbuds, both wired and wireless collection. Now my IEM collection begins. I believe this format (IEMs) provides the best sound/dollar value. These KZ ZSN PRO approach the $100 value in headphones or standard earbuds. Very clean or neutral, clear separation and accurate sound reproduction. If you are picky or want really accurate clean sound. YOU MUST consider buying an ear tip kit for $5-$10 as well. Fortunately they will help with all your earbuds of any kind. I tested them (KZ ZSN PRO) using lossless files with a quality DAC and all different genres of music. They are excellent! Buy them. For $20 you might discover why IEMs have an inherent sound reproduction advantage.

reviews.caption: Better than my Customs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
reviews.review: Respectfully do not agree with the post about no Low End. Agree that these have more 'natural' response in the mids and highs but I have dialed up the low end on my EQ of source audio and there is plenty of bass to be had. Curious if perhaps the other user got a bad pair. In either event, I am a musician of 35+ years and an Audio snob. These things sound better to me than the $400 + customs I had made 3 years ago. Primarily for the reason that Mids and Highs are so responsive. Yes, we all want big bass, but at least compared to my customs, there was too much low end, not enough high's and mids on my customs. In a stage setting, this meant that vocals (especially) and other high end instruments got "lost' in my mix (Keys, Sax, etc.) These have far more of a balances response to me from Lows to HIghs. And are priced at 7% of what I paid for my customs! Can't speak to longevity as yet - only had them for a few months but so far, could not be happier. Buying another pair just to have them on tap.

reviews.caption: Basically ear monitors
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
reviews.review: Pros:-Incredible sound quality-Look cool-Best sound per dollar-The cord is designed to prevent wear at stress points-Great treble and bass (as a bass lover I can confirm)Cons:-Audible hiss without a soundcard-Needs said soundcard to function optimally-Kinda funky wearing style (whatever works I guess)First week impressions: When first plugged in, I found out that they are so sensitive to input that they actually relayed the base level of electricity sent to keep them on. This results in a light hissing that can be heard at low to medium volumes. So I got a cheap soundcard and, for my laptop at least, they work amazingly. As many have said, this is the best sound per dollar on the market. However, my phone (Galaxy S8) has no way of using a soundcard, so the hiss persists and I have to use other earbuds to stay sane. If you always use a high volume, this should not be a problem.4 stars.

reviews.caption: Nicht das "Gelbe vom Ei"
reviews.date: Reviewed in Germany on January 27, 2021
reviews.review: Ich habe mir die Teile gekauft, weil ich eine Alternative zu den normalen In-Ear-Kopfhörern ausprobieren wollte.Okay, Stecker drauf, die richtigen Silikonteile aufgesteckt und aufgesetzt. Soweit so gut....ABER: Eigentlich hatte ich mir vom Sound, bezogen auf die Beschreibung und den Bewertern, wesentlich mehr erhofft. Nein, das ist eine absolute Enttäuschung. Kein Bass, selbst bei voll hochgezogenem EQ.... Da sind sogar 0815-Teile für 5€ klanglich besser. Vom Klang her erinnern die mich eher an meine Studiokopfhörer, allerdings reagieren die auf die Bassanhebung......Ich behalte sie trotzdem - Beim Arbeiten schirmen die wenigstens gut den Umgebungslärm ab und verrutschen nicht so leicht.Für's reine Musikhören eher nicht zu gebrauchen.......

reviews.caption: Impressive sounds for a budget price
reviews.date: Reviewed in Singapore on August 23, 2020
reviews.review: I have owned other more expensive earbuds, but nothing compares to th e KZ ZSN. Construction is good and solid, the clarity and bass is good with the supplied silicone ear inserts. I changed these to bootleg sponge ear inserts from my older ear pieces and the sound improved tremendously. The bass, however, becomes tight and a little subdued. I've hear better bass on others. All-in-all, I'm impressed and they are now my current in-ears when I'm not using my Grados.

reviews.caption: Calidad de audio exelente
reviews.date: Reviewed in Mexico on March 7, 2021
reviews.review: Muy buena calidad de sonido mucho mejor que otras marcas y por un precio increible
